section.title: Overview
section.para: The minimize command in GMAT allows variables to minimize by using a defined optimizer in optimize sequence.

listitem.para: Must set in order to use Minimize Command.
Must be defined in order to use minimize command in optimize sequence.

section.title: Using the GUI
section.para: The Minimize dialog contains two menus, which are optimizer and variable to be minimized. Each properties are needed to be selected to accomplish a minimization. Also, users have to define an optimizer before, and users need to define an undefined variable or function if users would like to apply.

listitem.para: Must select the optimizer, generally you can choose the solver in optimize command
Variable to be Minimized - Drop Down Menus
Must select the variable or the function to be minimized

entry.para: The OptimizerName option allows the user to specify which solver to use to minimize the cost function.
Options: { Variable, Spacecraft parameter, or Array element }

The Arg field allows the user to specify the function to be minimized upon convergence of the solver given by OptimizerName. Arg can be any of the following: Variable, Array element, or Spacecraft Parameter or any other 1x1 numeric user defined parameter.
